'Manipur (Kangleipak)' (Pron: ) ) is a state in northeastern India, with the
city of Imphal as its capital. Its people include the Meetei, Pangal, Naga,
Kuki, and Mizo, who speak different languages of branches of the Tibeto-Burman
family. The state is bounded by Nagaland to the north, Mizoram to the south, and
Assam to the west; Burma lies to the east. It covers an area of .

The Meetei, who live primarily in the state's valley region, form the primary
ethnic group (60% of the total population). Their language, Meeteilon (also
known as Manipuri), is the lingua franca in the state.
